description: First numerator and then denominator of the 1/3-Pascal triangle (by row). To get a 1/3-Pascal triangle, replace "2" in the third row of the Pascal triangle by "1/3" and calculate all other rows as in the Pascal triangle.
links: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: thirdPascal[1]={1}; thirdPascal[2]={1,1}; thirdPascal[3]={1,1/3,1}; thirdPascal[n_] := thirdPascal[n] = Join[{1}, Map[Total,Partition[thirdPascal[n-1],2,1]],{1}]; Flatten[Map[Transpose, Transpose[{Numerator[#], Denominator[#]}]&[Map[thirdPascal,Range[20]]]]] (* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Apr 03 2013 *)
author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_
